supercontext.mission: Keep docs/orders/ limited to active work by relocating completed or superseded orders into docs/archive/orders/ with a verified status trail.

goal: Archive fulfilled development orders, document their completion references, and refresh contributor guidance so active collaborators only see current work.
execution_instructions: Confirm the orders you intend to archive are fully satisfied and already have completion evidence in docs/reports/ or equivalent logs.
Favor structured moves (copy then delete) instead of drag-and-drop so Git diffs remain reviewable.
If an order contains sensitive information or secrets, scrub the contents before moving it; otherwise preserve the file as-is for historical context.
Pause if any order appears partially complete or lacks evidence—capture a note in docs/reports/archive_audit.md instead of moving it blindly.

tasks.description: Inventory candidate orders in docs/orders/ that are complete or deprecated.
steps: List JSON files under docs/orders/ excluding templates and still-active orders (e.g., example-order-template.json, current provider tasks).
For each candidate, locate supporting completion proof (docs/reports/*.md, run logs, or merged PR references).
Create docs/reports/archive_audit.md summarizing which orders are ready to archive, including the evidence file path for each.

tasks.description: Relocate completed orders and ensure history stays traceable.
steps: For every order flagged in archive_audit.md, move the JSON file into docs/archive/orders/ preserving the filename.
If docs/archive/orders/README.md exists, append a short entry under an appropriate heading noting the move and referencing the supporting report.
Update docs/orders/README.md (or create it if missing) with a link to the archive and brief instructions on when to relocate finished orders.

tasks.description: Ensure contributor guidance reflects the new archival workflow.
steps: Update README.md or AGENTS.md with a one-liner reminding agents to archive fulfilled orders and consult docs/reports/archive_audit.md before creating duplicates.
If docs/reports/archive_audit.md contains TODOs (orders lacking evidence), highlight them in the guidance note so future agents know follow-up is required.
Optional: add a short Streamlit UI or CLI note (if relevant) pointing to the archival instructions for agents using the UI tooling.

acceptance_criteria: docs/orders/ contains only active orders plus reference templates after the archival move.
docs/archive/orders/ is updated with the relocated JSON files and a README entry noting the archival batch.
docs/reports/archive_audit.md lists archived orders, their evidence locations, and any remaining follow-ups.
Contributor guidance (README.md or AGENTS.md) references the archival flow so future contributors know the process.
No partially complete orders are accidentally archived; candidates without proof stay in docs/orders/ with a note in archive_audit.md.

what_not_to_do: Do not delete order history—always preserve the JSON content by moving it into docs/archive/orders/.
Do not archive an order lacking a completion report or equivalent evidence; record it in archive_audit.md instead.
Do not rename orders during archival unless necessary for clarity; if renaming is unavoidable, document the old/new names in archive_audit.md.
Do not stage generated artifacts beyond docs/reports/archive_audit.md without explicit approval.
constraints.escalation_guidance: If you discover active work depending on an order you plan to archive, stop and clarify ownership before moving it.
